data.description:
BattleGlide is an open world sandbox game where you can move and fight like a super hero.

- Explore a lively and open city by rope swinging, jumping, and climbing walls. Choose the time of day you want to fight crime: day, night, or in between.

- Take down criminals in countless creative ways, including grabbing, shooting, punching, disarming, or dropping them from the tallest skyscraper...

- Handle weapons realistically. Disarm your enemies or give them a taste of their own medicine!

- Use a variety of weapons to take down your enemies: fists, pistols, assault rifles, large props, baseball bats, explosives, and even frying pans.

changelog.change_log:
PATCH NOTES

WEAPONS:
- Two new weapons added: a combat knife and a pencil.
- Shooting an empty firearm will play a dry fire sound effect.
- Shooting while holding the charging handle will damage the player.

COMBAT:
- Added an option to disable automatic slow motion when dodging.
- NPCs may accidentally fire their weapon when dropped. Tased enemies will continue firing until the firearm is empty.
- NPCs will reload their weapons if they run out of ammo.
- Pulling an NPC while in the air will now sling both the player and the NPC.

CITY:
- A new type of crime in the city: Hostage on rooftop.
- Added a marker to indicate nearby events.
- Events can spawn much further from the player.

VISUALS:
- Player gloves' model and textures are much more detailed.
- Reduced player hand glow by 50%.
- Added blood decals for NPCs. You can paint them red with bullets or knives.
- Reduced camera's near clipping distance for better aiming.

PERFORMANCE:
- The game now runs at 90hz by default with an option to enable 72hz mode.
- Added dynamic FFR (fixed foveated rendering).
- Switched the rendering API from OpenGL to Vulkan.
- Optimized CPU performance for grabbing.
- Reduced complexity of smoke and text shaders.
- Reduced pedestrian rendering priority, improving CPU performance in crowded areas.

MISCELLANEOUS:
- Added multiple small improvements to the tutorial.
- The weapon spawn menu has been categorized for easier searches.
- Destructible objects have more realistic break forces.
- The player can bounce on walls using grabbed objects.
- The moon is visible at night.
- Stars are slightly more visible at dusk.
- Reduced collision smoke effect to avoid distractions and performance drops.
- NPCs should now always look at the player when grabbed.
- Improved haptics for grabbing NPCs.

BUG FIXES:
- Fixed an issue where the calculated velocity of a grabbed object was lower than its actual velocity.
- Fixed collision forces between high-speed moving objects.
- Fixed breakable wood crates not applying the correct velocity to their broken parts upon destruction.
- Fixed NPC rigging causing head distortion with rotation.
- Fixed the flying bug caused by attaching objects with ropes (added a secret way of doing it).
- Fixed an issue where NPCs would not reach the player after being pulled.
- Fixed the M4 bolt moving while firing.
- Fixed weapon mags not having collisions while being inserted.
- Fixed haptics rumbling for too long in slow motion.
- Fixed rapid slow motion hits not being registered.
- Fixed some sound effects not playing in slow motion.
- Fixed the spawn gun circle still showing up after the item is dropped.
- Fixed weapon fire rate being tied to frame rate.

UPDATE 2 (Massive update)

NPC:
- Replaced every blue pedestrian with detailed and interactive NPCs.
- NPCs can be pulled using ropes.
- NPCs with automatic weapons can fire in burst mode.
- Added a faction system that allows NPCs to pick sides and fight each other.
- NPCs will react to sound and dead bodies.
- NPCs can flee combat depending on their courage level.
- NPCs now have facial expressions.
- Weapons used by NPCs are now the same level of detail as the players'.
- Improved the combat positioning for NPCs. They no longer stay in the same spots while fighting the player.
- Improved the visuals for criminals.

WEAPONS:
- Added 2 new weapons: Pump-action shotgun, Suppressed submachine gun.
- Added 2 new physics weapons: Fire extinguisher, office chair.
- Added a spawn menu to the spawngun, which lets you spawn every type of NPCs and objects.
- Added silencers for every weapon in the game.
- Placing a magazine near a weapon automatically removes the previous magazine.
- Blocking a gunshot with an object will cause the holding hands to vibrate.
- Increased the spawngun spawn limit to 100 scene objects (items/npcs).

WORLD:
- Added a new time of day: Dusk.
- Added random criminal gunfights in the city.
- Added "hater pedestrians" that will attack the player at random times.
- Increased car density by 33%.
- Increased car rendering distance by 39%.
- Added fake distant traffic everywhere in the city.
- Moved the player start to a new location for an easier first-time swinging experience.

MISC:
- You can spawn magazines by reaching into your backpack with the trigger.
- Hands and rope color can now be selected using a color wheel.
- Added a joystick flipping option.
- Added a turn intensity option.
- Weapons are now categorized in the menu.
- Replaced the difficulty system with a global difficulty slider.
- Hitting something with an NPC will play haptics on the controllers.

BUG FIXES:
- Fixed criminals appearing low quality for Quest 3 users.
- Fixed unnatural NPC rotations.
- Fixed an issue that prevents the player from flipping.
- Fixed NPC ragdoll rolling on the floor.
- Fixed movement sensitivity for some users who experience joystick drift.
- Fixed rope not applying force immediately to ragdolls and items.
- Fixed accidental rope pulls while rotating or flipping.
- Fixed a memory leak with the pedestrian spawn system.
- Fixed rope not applying force to NPCs in some cases.
- Fixed rope shoot animation playing when attaching two ropes together.
- Fixed automatic weapons shooting while in the menu.

PERFORMANCE:
- Optimized the number of physics joints for NPCs.
- Added a culling distance for multiple small objects, which should reduce the number of draw calls.
- Added a system that automatically optimizes NPCs' physics and ticking depending on distance.
- Replaced some unnecessary stationary lights with static lights in combat levels.
- Reduced ticking on some items.
